name: Introduction to Physics
description: Covers basic mechanics, motion, and Newton's laws for first-year students.

name: Chemistry Fundamentals
description: Atoms, elements, reactions, and the periodic table explained simply.

name: Introduction to Biology
description: Explore cells, genetics, and biological systems.

name: Earth and Environmental Science
description: Learn about ecosystems, sustainability, and human impact on Earth.

name: Scientific Research Basics
description: Understand how to design, conduct, and analyze scientific experiments.

name: Advanced Physics and Thermodynamics
description: Covers thermodynamics, statistical mechanics, and modern physics.

name: Organic and Inorganic Chemistry
description: A detailed look at molecular bonding, structures, and chemical synthesis.

name: Advanced Environmental Systems
description: Modeling ecological systems and understanding global environmental issues.

name: Molecular Biology and Genetics
description: Study DNA replication, gene expression, and biotechnological advances.

name: Quantum Mechanics Basics
description: An intermediate course in quantum concepts, wave functions, and atomic theory.

name: Quantum Field Theory and Advanced Physics
description: Deep dive into particle physics and field theory for researchers.

name: Neuroscience and Cognitive Systems
description: Research-level study of brain systems, neural networks, and cognition.

name: Advanced Biochemistry and Molecular Mechanisms
description: Focus on enzymes, protein folding, and cellular processes.

name: Climate Science and Earth Systems Research
description: Advanced models of climate dynamics and environmental prediction.

name: Astrophysics and Cosmology
description: Exploration of stars, galaxies, and the structure of the universe.
